itl.enabler.api

Class Fallback

  • java.lang.Object
    • itl.enabler.api.Fallback

  • public class Fallback
extends java.lang.Object
    This class encapsulates the fallback system of The Enabler.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Fallback.FallBackModeEventListener
      Event Listener for the Fallback class

    • Method Detail

      • addFallbackEventListener

        public void addFallbackEventListener(Fallback.FallBackModeEventListener ev)
        Adds an event listener to the list of registered event listeners for the Fallback class
        See Also:
        Fallback.FallBackModeEventListener

      • getActiveClientCount

        public int getActiveClientCount()
        Returns:
        the current number of active clients.

        Note : The active clients are online terminals which have indicated in there connection parameters that they are active.
        When active client count falls to zero and a profile has automatic fallback option set, the system will automatically switch to fallback mode.

      • getMode

        public FallbackMode getMode()
        Returns:
        the current mode of the fallback system

      • isManualFallbackState

        public boolean isManualFallbackState()
        Returns:
        a boolean value indicating the state of manual fallback pumps.

        Note : A value of trueindicates the manual fallback pumps are in fallback mode.

      • removeEventListener

        public void removeEventListener(Fallback.FallBackModeEventListener ev)
        Removes an event listener from the list of registered event listeners for the Fallback class.

        Call this method whenever disposing object references in your application having links to the fallback. It is highly recommended to call this method otherwise event listeners may still be registered, references maintained and will NOT be garbage collected.

        Parameters:
        ev - the Fallback Mode Event Listener to be removed

      • setManualFallback

        public void setManualFallback(boolean state)
                       throws EnablerException
        Change the state of all manual fallback pumps.

        Note : This method is used to manually switch all pumps which have a profile fallback allow option set but do not have the automatic fallback option enabled to the fallback mode.
        This will only work if the system is in a fallback state and will fail if there are active clients or there are no pumps with fallback option enabled in the profile.

        Throws:
        EnablerException
        See Also:
        Profile
